content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I love how this clash utilizes creative use of regexes. All three modes definitely work.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Creative way of turning a hit and run into the size of a clash, nice job!

lgtm except validator 3. I was able to pass all the test cases and the rest of the validators but 3 didn't pass because I forgot to check that the regex match starts at the beginning of the string. This is, of course, my fault, but you should switch test case 3 and its validator for people who are dumb like me.

Here's some code I wrote to generate pseudo-random vehicle descriptions for the test cases, if anyone is interested:

https://ato.pxeger.com/run?1=VZBNasMwEIXp1jfobggE_JMINw2lWRTTM5R2USOCLI9jtYokJAtjGp-kmyzaS_U0FUlM6e69b5jHzPv8sr4ajsdv3zXL-5-ra66l9tbBA8z7sm9Fh1BJxt9hZxEVWKyD9wgDSql7MEKdRgNUVvcKtGVqh2C8NRJpxNkUxbU3CA5rpuDp-YVGLPC4TItHQopXChkEnQe9oekqSTeR8Z2DdZ6TTuzRkT0zHwdxgBIYca1vGollvrjLYjFfJ5Qg4-3WScExXmXhhjq-TZLT0vaGvGmhxrRYLuDy3V8CDYz9A0BhnOwlIJ3BbDw3dClqKuwX

Thanks for spotting that! I hate hidden edge cases in validators, I've made it so that mistake will now cause a fail in Test 3 as well as validator 3.

Similarly, there are now test and validator fails for forgetting to end the regex match. I hope it's ready for approval now.
I still pass all the test cases without the $ at the end.

That's weird. When I test without the $ I fail Tests 3-5 and validators 4-5. Are you sure you reloaded the IDE? It keeps the old version of the tests if you don't actually close the tab and re-open it (refreshing doesn't reload the latest version).

Ahhh I see the difference now. My code:
r=/^#{gets.chop.tr ?*,?.}/
Creates a regex for the whole string, since we know that only the registration number has wild cards and the color and car-type should match. The reason your code fails is because it only matches the registration number using regex.

In other words, both work :D

Mine works without the $ as long as the car types are the set SUV, Coupe, sedan. If you plan on adding other random car types, like SUVmini (idk cars), then mine would break.
That makes sense, if you do things that way then missing the $ won't be an issue, you just need to be sure to not miss the ^. :)
